name: Rice
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the rice and a pinch of salt. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

name: Quinoa
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer.
Bring 2 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

name: Lentils
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of lentils under cold water and remove any debris or damaged lentils.
Bring 3 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the lentils and reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer uncovered for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
Drain any excess water and season as desired.

name: Gluten-Free Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add 1 pound of gluten-free pasta and cook according to the package instructions (typically 8-10 minutes).
Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Drain the pasta and rinse under warm water to remove excess starch. Serve immediately.

name: Millet
instructions: Rinse 1 cup of millet under cold water until the water runs clear.
Toast the millet in a dry pan over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently, until it smells nutty.
Bring 2 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Add the toasted millet, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving.

name: Gluten-Free Couscous
instructions: Bring 1 cup of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Remove from heat and stir in 1 cup of gluten-free couscous.
Cover and let sit for 5 minutes to absorb the liquid.
Fluff with a fork before serving.

name: Polenta
instructions: Bring 4 cups of water or broth to a boil in a medium saucepan.
Gradually whisk in 1 cup of polenta in a steady stream to prevent clumping.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, for 25-30 minutes until the polenta is thick and creamy.
Season with salt and optional butter or olive oil before serving.

name: Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 400째F (200째C).
Wash and scrub 1 medium sweet potato per serving. Poke several holes in each potato with a fork.
Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and bake for 45-50 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork.
Slice open and serve as desired.

name: Spaghetti Squash
instructions: Preheat oven to 400째F (200째C).
Cut 1 spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds.
Place the halves cut-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the flesh is tender and easily shredded with a fork.
Use a fork to scrape out the spaghetti-like strands and serve.

name: Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Grate 1 head of cauliflower or pulse florets in a food processor until they resemble rice.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the cauliflower rice and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender.
Season as desired and serve.
